newsitem.title: BULGARIA: SOCCER-STOICHKOV NAMED FOR BULGARIA DESPITE VOW NOT TO PLAY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-STOICHKOV NAMED FOR BULGARIA DESPITE VOW NOT TO PLAY.

text.p: Volatile striker Hristo Stoichkov has been named in Bulgaria's squad for a World Cup qualifier against Cyprus on April 2 despite saying he would not play for the national team, soccer officials said on Wednesday.
Stoichkov quit the team last year demanding the resignation of the country's soccer chiefs.
He criticised them for axing former coach Dimitar Penev, who took Bulgaria to the semifinals of the World Cup for the first time in their history in 1994.
But under Penev's management at the European championship last June the team failed to get past the first round.
Last December Stoichkov pulled out of a World Cup qualifier away to Cyprus because of injury.
New coach Hristo Bonev said he had not spoken to Stoichkov but had sent him a telegram to his Barcelona team.
"I know Hristo's good character and that is why I think that he will come," Bonev told reporters.
So far in the European qualifying group five, Bulgaria have lost to Israel and beaten Luxembourg and Cyprus.

Squad - Zdravko Zdravkov, Dimitar Popov, Trifon Ivanov, Ivailo Yordanov, Georgi Ginchev, Zlatko Yankov, Krasimir Balakov, Emil Kostadinov, Daniel Borimirov, Hristo Stoichkov, Georgi Donkov, Ilian Iliev, Kostadin Vidolov, Radostin Kishishev, Anatoli Nankov, Georgi Bachev, Ivailo Petkov, Georgi Ivanov, Georgi Antonov, Ivailo Andonov, Dobromir Mitov, Milen Petkov.
